name: Paradise Inn at Mount Rainier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Paradise Inn at the end of June. The weather was cold, snowy and foggy, but the Paradise Inn was wonderful. The location is great and the service from both the hotel and dining staff was excellent. The lodge is beautiful and although the rooms are small and sparse, they are adequate. The lobby is wonderful and we loved the afternoon tea service and sitting in the lobby at night with the fireplace roaring. The park ranger staff was great and always available for questions and we enjoyed the evening ranger programs.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and good service

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Inn many times over 25 years, after backpacking trips, with family and solo a time or two. I must say the rebuild went very well except for loosing the small bar that used to grace the Inn. That was a real loss and will be missed by many.
reviews.title: Unique and wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a shame that a few people just don't get the Inn but I guess it takes all kinds. This is one of the true treasures in the country and should be on everyone's bucket list of places to visit and enjoy!
reviews.title: Food, atmosphere, location great, rooms needed maintenance

reviews.text: Paradise Inn is an historic landmark and offers a spectacular location to access Mt.Rainier. The dining room offered very good food and the park service had wonderful programs through out the day. The rooms however were extremely small and ours at least was in poor repair... drawers were broken, blind in bathroom didn't close, However the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. One needs to keep the persepective that this is not a resort or 5 star hotel and the room is just for sleeping. It is what is outside the room and hotel that should have brought you to Paradise.
reviews.title: A place in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about staying at the Paradise Inn after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I have to say - take a chance, it is truly a one-of-a-kind experience.
reviews.title: gorgeous and relaxing--just what we were looking for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For two nights while exploring Mt. Rainier National Park, we stayed in a double-bed lodge room on the mezzanine level of the Paradise Inn. (No elevator, but only one flight of stairs!) Although I was a little bit nervous about the shared bathroom setup, it really was no big deal. There was a sink in our room for brushing teeth and getting a drink of water. The bathroom was clean and never busy, and we didn’t even have to wait for the showers after hiking all day. The one-person shower stalls have their own closets off of the main hall.
reviews.title: Great in-park accommodations

reviews.text: The bedroom itself is small, kind of worrisome at first, but we were able to store all of our luggage in the nooks and crannies of the room, so that the size of the room was never really a problem.
reviews.title: We were pleasantly surprised.
Won't go bank
reviews.text: The parking lot dedicated to inn guests was full for our whole stay, but we were given a parking pass to leave in the window to park at the nearby Visitor’s Center lot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate dinner in the Dining Room the first night, where the selection is small and a bit pricey, but fully satisfying. There is also a cafe and a gift shop in the lobby of the inn, and there are nightly lecture programs staged in the lobby to entertain guests of the inn and others.
reviews.title: Rustic accommodations with amateur staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each night as we planned the next day’s itinerary, we were extremely grateful for the advice and assistance of the front desk staff, especially Tyler, who gave us maps and directed us to the best hikes for our interests.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Our family had visited Mt. Rainier several times and it was on our wish list to stay at the Inn. We had the oppurtunity last year and it was everthing we thought it would be. Hiking, playing cards in the lobby, and then walking outside to see tons of stars. We woke up to the view of the mountain the next morning. During planning we'd read several negative reviews but appreciated one review that told people to get over some of the small & dated rooms - you're staying on the mountain! We couldn't agree more with him. Yes our room was tiny but it was clean and a million dollar view. I hope to stay there again!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed here a three times, twice before the structural upgrade recently, and once more just this past October. It was the last weekend it was open for the year, and as usual, a full house of guests. The lobby is simply spectacular, on par with the best in the National Park lodge system. The rooms are a bit of a mixed bag - - the Annex rooms feature private baths, but are in need of some decor updating. Not terrible, but just a little dated. The main inn rooms don't have private baths, and are very small. They have been updated somewhat. But we didn't spend much time in them, the lobby is the main attraction indoors, and the scenery is the main attraction outdoors. The food was good, a decent value considering the location. And the main dining room is beautiful as well. As others have said, don't expect luxurious accomodations or modern conveniences here. And in a National Park, you don't come for those things, right?
reviews.title: A Magical Place
Comparable to backpacker's hostel or campground
reviews.text: We agree with the reviewer who said the Paradise Inn is the absolute worst national park inn they've ever stayed in. It's the equivalent of a backpacker's hostel or camping. If you're okay with that then you'll be okay here. The views are beautiful, but for us, not worth the terrible hotel experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was tiny, barely space to turn around in, with twin beds (not a double/queen!) which were lumpy and uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Improved from 2008-ambience-primitive hotel..doesn't matter. GO-Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walls of the rooms are paper thin and you can hear everything going on around you.
reviews.title: Paradise is amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there Sept. 18-20 with wife. Lovely place, very cozy. The food is average and while seeming overpriced, I thought you got a lot for your money. The chicken parm, on the other hand, wasn't that great. Lunch salad was dry. Met another Floridian working there named Aurora, very sweet! Rooms and showers were very clean. Rooms are very small so be prepared. That wasn't a big deal for us. Beds are quite uncomfortable and rather small. I am 6'2" 160lbs. and wife is 5'7" and we were both on there with no problem.
reviews.title: The price you pay for such a beautiful view

reviews.text: Take this advice.
reviews.title: Not nearly as bad as some reviews say!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If possible, book a room as far away from the stairs as possible. There is a sitting area by the stairs where people congregate and you can hear everything. Sounds carries in that place and you can hear everything. Floors don't creak, but you hear every door on the floor open and close. Never heard any voices next door, but you'll wake up when the masses head to the showers or out to hike at 7:00am. We got about ~4 hours sleep each night despite going to be before midnight.
reviews.title: Labor Day at Mt Rainier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But this is the place to be if you want to hike along the mountain. No doubt.
reviews.title: Unique opportunity for history and natural beauty

reviews.text: Clean: yes
reviews.title: Accessability to the Mtn. awesome.

description: Built in 1916 and designated as one of the "Great Lodges of the West" this historic guest lodge sits in the shadow of Mount Rainier surrounded by mountain meadows lush with wildflowers. Miles of hiking trails just outside the front door lead to adventures in all directions and offer panoramic views of glaciers and waterfalls.
